幏字的基本解释

幏
jià
古代中国西南少数民族作为赋税交纳的布。亦称“賨布”。

幏字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jià］
［《廣韻》古訝切，去禡，見。］
［《廣韻》古牙切，平麻，見。］
古代西南地区少数民族所织的布名。

幏字的康熙字典解释

【寅集中】【巾字部】　幏； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页335第06
【唐韻】古訝切【集韻】居迓切【韻會】居訝切【正韻】居亞切，?音駕。【玉篇】蠻布也。【韻會】漢制名，賦蠻布爲幏，猶中國言稅也。【左思·魏都賦】賨幏積墆，琛幣充牣。　又【廣韻】古牙切【集韻】居牙切，?音嘉。義同。

幏字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
幏字的起名意思

暂无。

Also
Basic explanation of words
Also
jià
In ancient China, ethnic minorities in southwest China used to pay taxes. Also known as "賨布".
Also
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jià］
["Guangyun" ancient surprised and cut, go to 禡, see. ]
["Guangyun" ancient teeth cut, plain hemp, see. ]
The name of the cloth woven by ethnic minorities in ancient Southwest China.
Also
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Yin Collection] [Scarf Character Department] 　幏; Kangxi Strokes: 13; Page Number: Page 335 06
[Tang Yun] Ancient Xingqie [Jiyun] Ju Lingqie [Yunhui] Ju Xingqie [Positive Rhyme] Ju Yaqie, sound driving. [Jade articles] Man cloth also. [Rhyme Club] The name is made in Han, and it is named as a man cloth, which is like a tax in Chinese dialect. [Zuo Si·Wei Du Fu] Suddenly accumulate, and the coins are filled.　[Guang Yun] Ancient Tooth Cut [Ji Yun] Ju Tooth Cut,? Yinjia. The same meaning.
